meanings.definition: The quality of being pompous or self-important.
meanings.sent1: Her pomposity made it hard for others to approach her.
meanings.sent2: His pomposity was evident in the way he spoke down to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat's pomposity was on full display as it strutted around the room.
meanings.sent4: The pomposity of the old oak tree overshadowed all the other plants in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's pomposity was so extreme that even the principal found it amusing.

meanings.definition: An instance of being pompous or self-important.
meanings.sent1: The politician's pomposity during the debate turned off many voters.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't help but chuckle at the pomposity of the squirrel as it demanded more nuts.
meanings.sent3: The pomposity of the toddler pretending to be a king was both adorable and hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The pomposity of the storm clouds warned of an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The pomposity of the peacock's strut caught the attention of all the zoo visitors.
